meanings.definition: To make someone unable to move or feel all or part of their body.
meanings.sent1: The spider's venom can paralyse its prey, making it easier to catch.
meanings.sent2: The accident paralysed his legs, leaving him unable to walk.
meanings.sent3: The idea of public speaking can paralyse even the most confident person.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure can paralyse one's ability to take risks and grow.
meanings.sent5: The icy water seemed to paralyse his entire body, making it hard to swim.

meanings.definition: To make someone unable to think or act normally, especially because of fear or shock.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected news seemed to paralyse her mind, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise paralysed him with fear, causing him to freeze in place.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the spider on the wall seemed to paralyse him with irrational terror.
meanings.sent4: The thought of failing the exam seemed to paralyse his ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave seemed to paralyse her thoughts, making it hard to think clearly.
